Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured Wild goat pottery bowl; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: pale slip; black-figure decoration consisting of deer grazing to left (head, antler, ear, neck with added red, one foreleg and shoulder remaining); simple rosette and blob as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.988)
